articles.title: IFRC President and her party interviewed
articles.content:
New road constructed 
  Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A new road was recently constructed along the east coast of North Hamgyong Province, the northern part of Korea.
   The 90 Kilometre-long road connects Yombunjin, in Kyongsong county with Mt. Chilbo, called (Hambuk Kumgang).
   It is 9-13 metres wide.
   The completion of road building helps facilitate traffic of the residents and promote conveniences of visitors to the scenic spots in the region.
   The road built along the east coast commands a fine view of seascape, fishing villages, waterfalls and scenic spots.
   Observation stands, pavilions and scores of animal sculptures along the road are in good harmony with the fine scenery in the vicinity.
   A tourist road, 9.5 kilometers long, was constructed in Mt. Chilbo along with this road.

articles.title: People's rally in S. Korea
articles.content:
IFRC President and her party interviewed
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- President Astrid Noeklebye Heiberg of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and her party on a visit to Korea had an interview with journalists on November 9.
   Present there was head of an IFRC delegation to the DPRK Sten Swedlund. 
   In the interview the President mentioned the inspection of IFRC-assisted projects in Korea and future work of the IFRC.
  She said that there is enough justification for continued delivery of food and she will inform the international community and donators of it.
   Answers were given to the questions put by the journalists.

articles.title: Film show to mark Poland's Independence Day
articles.content:
People's rally in S. Korea

    Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A people's rally was held in Seoul on November 8 with the attendance of more than 30,000 people under the co-sponsorship of 60 organisations, including the "Korean Confederation of Trade Unions," the "National Teachers Union" and the "Citizens' Federation for Democratic Society," a Seoul-based radio said.
   The rally adopted a letter of ten requests, including punishment of those responsible for economic bankruptcy, suspension of lay-off, settlement of the issue concerning debts of peasant families and legalisation of trade union of teachers, and decided to send it to all political parties and the Prime Minister.
   The participants in the rally in a resolution said that in case the authorities ignore the will of the people pro-democracy forces will jointly launch into a movement for the right to existence and economic sovereignty.
   More than 2,000 of the participants occupied the road in front of Yongdungpho Railway Station in Seoul to wage a sit-in strike.

articles.title: Release of Hwang Son called for
articles.content:
Film show to mark Poland's Independence Day
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A film show was held in Pyongyang on November 9 on the occasion of the Independence Day of Poland.
   Invited to the film show were Mieczyslaw Dedo, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Polish embassy here, and embassy officials.
   Present there were Ri Song Ho, vice chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and Concurrently vice chairman of the Korea-Poland Friendship Association, and officials concerned.
   Participants saw a Polish feature film.

articles.title: Japan-U.S. joint military manoeuvres in full swing =KCNA commentary=
articles.content:
Release of Hwang Son called for
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland (CPRF) issued a statement on November 9 bitterly denouncing the South Korean ruling quarters for arresting and persecuting Hwang Son on charges of violating the anti-reunification fascist "National Security Law". 
   Hwang Son had visited Pyongyang in the capacity of a delegate of the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) that represents the south headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students For the Country's Reunification (Pomchonghakryon).
   The statement says Hanchongryon delegate Hwang Son visited North Korea recently and conducted just activities to inform the students and other people in the north of ardent patriotic desire of the South Korean students and other people for national reconciliation and reunification, learn a long history and culture of the Korean nation and promote national independence and great unity.
   The arrest of Hwang, a praiseworthy daughter of the nation, on the strength of the "NSL" clearly shows that the "reconciliation" and "cooperation" on the lips of the South Korean authorities are a gross deception to mislead public opinion and conceal the true colors as the partitionists, it says, and continues:
   The CPRF, considering the arrest and harsh persecution of Hwang Son unpardonable treacheries and cruel fascist brutality, vehemently denounces them in the name of the whole nation.
    The South Korean authorities should not incriminate her with unreasonable charges, but set her free unconditionally and stop fascist suppression of Hanchongryon and other pro-reunification patriotic forces.

articles.title: Letters of eternal value
articles.content:
Japan-U.S. joint military manoeuvres in full swing =KCNA commentary=
      Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) --  Frantic U.S.-Japan joint military manoeuvres have reportedly been staged allegedly to cope with the "event of contingency on the Korean peninsula."
   The manoeuvres of the U.S. marine corps and the Japanese ground "self-defence force" began on November 5 as part of the "Japan-U.S. joint manoeuvres." on the same day, naval joint manoeuvres started, involving nine ships of the U.S. carrier flotilla and twenty warships of the Japanese maritime "self-defence force," 40,000 troops in all.
   The war exercises which began in advance of the above-mentioned manoeuvres are being staged on the ground and in the sky. Joint manoeuvres of the U.S. forces and the Japanese "self-defence forces" are in full swing throughout the Japanese islands.
   As a consequence,  U.S. military bases in Japan and the training places of the "SDF" are clouded with powder-smoke, filled with deafening gun reports. Blockade of non-military roads and low-altitude flight of warplanes do damage to the livelihood of the residents, causing negative impact.
   Publications of the U.S. forces described the frantic manoeuvres as a "large-scale war game on the ground, in the sea and the sky." a local assembly of Japan expressed deep concern at the "large-scale manoeuvres being staged under the simulated conditions of the event of contingency on the Korean peninsula," saying that the "manoeuvres seem to be staged throughout Japan."
    The developments prove that the U.S. and Japan are carrying into practice  the "guidelines for Japan-U.S. defence cooperation" that they revised for the purpose of provoking another Korean War and realising their wild ambition for domination over Asia and the rest of the world.
   What is particularly dangerous is that the U.S.-Japan joint military manoeuvres began on the back of the Foal Eagle war exercises of the U.S. and South Korea, tightening the "tripartite military alliance" of the U.S., Japan and South Korea.
   All this clearly shows that with a view to stifling the DPRK by force of arms the U.S., Japan and the South Korean authorities are expanding and strengthening the undisguised and reckless war exercises for aggression on the DPRK through the medium of the tightened military tie-up, while describing the DPRK's launch of artificial satellite as "missile threat" and using it for justifying  massive arms buildup.

articles.title: DPRK government economic delegation leaves for Libya and Syria
articles.content:
Letters of eternal value
  Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The immortal revolutionary paean "Song of General Kim Jong Il," a famous m
Masterpiece "Nostalgia" and "Illustrious Commander born of heaven Kim Jong Il" are engraved as letters of eternal value on the natural rocks of well-known Mt. Chilbo in Korea.
   The letters represent the loyalty and filial piety of the Korean people who want to hand down to posterity the exploits General Secretary Kim Jong Il performed during his personal guidance on the mountain.
   Mt. Chilbo is reminiscent of the glorious revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il, who is working hard to provide the people with better conditions for their cultural life and entertainment.
   Kim Jong Il went there in June Juche 85 (1996) and told how to turn the mountain into better cultural pleasure ground for the people.
   During his long journey from inner Chilbo to outer Chilbo and sea Chilbo in November Juche 85, he told how to develop the mountain and took a concrete step concerning the building of hotels for visitors and public service facilities and preservation and management of the scenic spot.
   Mt. Chilbo (659 metres above sea level) is on the east coast in the northern part of Korea. It has been called "Hambuk Kumgang" from ancient times.
   The mountain covers an area of about 250 square kilometres.
   It boasts of superb scenic beauty because Mt. Obong, Mansa Peak and other strangely-shaped peaks, Kumgang and Kuryong ponds and other ponds, waterfalls, natural caves, the peak of ten thousand forms and seascape along the coastline of about 40 kilometres are in good harmony.
   It is furnished with all facilities for the convenience of tourists.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok meets delegation of Mongolian government
articles.content:
DPRK government economic delegation leaves for Libya and Syria
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government economic delegation led by Kang Jong Mo, Minister of Foreign Trade, left Pyongyang today for Libya and Syria.

articles.title: Lake Sohung
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok meets delegation of Mongolian government

   Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, today met and conversed with a government delegation of Mongolia led by B. Batbayar, Acting Minister of Finance and member of the State Great Ikh Hural (Parliament),  who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
   The delegation arrived here today by plane.
   It conveyed to an official concerned relief material from the Mongolian government.
